utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That is IT! You just barge in here, you don't knock

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm sorry!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You have no respect for anybody's privacy!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Rachel, wait, wait.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, you wait! This is ridiculous!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Can I just say one thing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? What?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's a relatively open weave and I can still see your... nipular areas.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, honey, honey, tell them the story about your patient who thinks things are, like, other things. Y'know? Like, the phone rings and she takes a shower.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: That's pretty much it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oops!

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: But you tell it really well, sweetie.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thanks. Okay, now go away so we can talk about you.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: Okay. I'll miss you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Isn't he great?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He's so cute! And he seems to like you so much.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know, I know. So sweet... and so complicated. And for a shrink, he's not too shrinky, y'know?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So, you think you'll do it on his couch?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I don't know, I don't know. I think that's a little weird, y'know? Vinyl.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okaaay. Any of you guys want anything else?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, yes, could I have one of those.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I'm sorry, we're all out of those. Anybody else?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: Did I, uh, did I miss something?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, she's still upset because I saw her boobies.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You what? Wh what were you doing seeing her boobies?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It was an accident. Not like I was across the street with a telescope and a box of donuts.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, okay, could we change the subject, please?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, 'cause hello, these are not her boobies, these are her breasts.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, Pheebs, I was hoping for more of a change.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'know, I don't know why you're so embarrassed, they were very nice boobies.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Nice? They were nice. I mean, that's it? I mean, mittens are nice.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okaaay, rock, hard place, me.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: You're so funny! He's really funny! I wouldn't wanna be there when when the laughter stops.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Whoah whoah, back up there, Sparky. What'd you mean by that?

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: Oh, just seems as though that maybe you have intimacy issues. Y'know, that you use your humour as a way of keeping people at a distance.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: I mean hey! I just met you, I don't know you from Adam. ...Only child, right? Parents divorced before you hit puberty.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uhhuh, how did you know that?

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: It's textbook.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey you guys. Hey, you all know my dad, right?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey! Hey, Mr. Trib!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, how long are you in the city?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Just for a coupla days. I got a job midtown. I figure I'm better off staying with the kid than hauling my ass back and forth on the ferry. I don't know this one.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, this is my friend Roger.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Hey, hey. Good to meet you, Roger.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: You too, sir.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: What happened to the, uh, puppet guy?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dad, dad.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Oh, 'scuse me. So Ross, uh, how's the wife? Off there too, uh? Uh, Chandler, quick, say something funny!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Gotta go. I miss you too, I love you, but it's getting real late now

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Ma. Listen, I made the appointment with Dr. Bazida, and... Excuse me? Did you know this isn't Ma?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Her name's Ronni. She's a pet mortician.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure. So how long you been...

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Remember when you were a little kid, I used to take you to the navy yard and show you the big ships?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Since then?!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: No, it's only been six years. I just wanted to put a nice memory in your head so you'd know that I wasn't always such a terrible guy. ...Joe. Y'ever been in love?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: ...I d'know.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Then y'haven't. You're burning your tomatoes.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You're one to talk.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Joe, your dad's in love big time. And the worst part of it is, it's with two different women.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh man. Please tell me one of 'em is Ma.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Of course, course one of 'em's Ma. What's the matter with you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It's like if you woke up one day and found out your dad was leading this double life. He's like actually some spy, working for the C.I.A. That'd be cool.... This blows!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know, I mean, why can't parents just stay parents? Why do they have to become people? Why do they have... Why can't you stop staring at my breasts?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What? What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Did you not get a good enough look the other day?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Alright, alright. We're all adults here, there's only one way to resolve this. Since you saw her boobies, I think, uh, you're gonna have to show her your peepee.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'know, I don't see that happening?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: C'mon, he's right. Tit for tat.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well I'm not showing you my 'tat.'

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: And Rog.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: C'mon up.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, good. Rog is here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What's the matter with Rog?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, it's nothing, it's a little thing... I hate that guy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What, so he was a little analytical. That's what he does, y'know? C'mon, he's not that bad.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y'see, that's where you're wrong. Why would I marry her if I thought on any level thatthat she was a lesbian?

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: I dunno. Maybe you wanted your marriage to fail.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why? Why would I why? Why? Why? Why?

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: I don't know. Maybe maybe low self-esteem, maybe maybe to compensate for overshadowing a sibling, maybe you...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait-wait, go back to that sibling thing.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: Well, I don't know. I mean, it's conceivable that you wanted to sabotage your marriage so that the sibling would feel less of a failure in the eyes of the parents.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That that's ridiculous! I don't feel guilty for her failures!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh! So you think I'm a failure!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Isn't he good?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nonono, thatthat's not what I was saying...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y'know, all these years, I thought you were on my side. But maybe what you were doing was sucking up to Mom and Dad so they'd keep liking you better!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, I married a lesbian to make you look good!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You're right! I mean you're right! It wasn't just the Weebles, but it was the Weeble Play Palace, and and the Weebles' Cruise Ship. Oh, which had this little lifeboat for the Weebles to wobble in.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: That's tough. Tough stuff. C'mon, Pheebs, we're gonna catch that movie, we gotta get going.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Feel better, Rachel, 'kay?

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: Geez, we're gonna be late, sweetie...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Listen, thanks for everything, Mon.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You're welcome.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: Listen guys, it was great seeing you again. Mon, um, easy on those cookies, okay? Remember, they're just food, they're not love.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hate that guy!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Night, you guys.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh look, it's the woman we ordered.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey. Can, uh, can we help you?

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Oh, no thanks, I'm just waiting for, uh, Joey Tribbiani.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'm Joey Tribbiani.

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Oh no, not you, big Joey. Oh my God, you're so much cuter than your pictures! I-I'm, I'm Ronni....Cheese Nip?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh, Joey's having an embolism, but I'd go for a Nip, y'know?

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Now, y'see, most people, when their pets pass on, they want 'em sorta laid out like they're sleeping. But occasionally you get your person who wants them in a pose. Like, chasing their tail, or, uh, jumping to catch a frisbee.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey, if I go first, I wanna be looking for my keys.

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: That's a good one!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Hey, Joe.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dad, Ronni's here.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Hey! Hello, babe! Wh what're what're you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Oh, uh, well, you left your good hair at my apartment, I figured you'd need it tomorrow for your meeting.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Thank you. Uh...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, who's up for a big game of Kerplunk?

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Look, I uh, I shouldn'ta come. I-I'd better get going, I don't wanna miss the last train.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: I don't want you taking that thing.

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Oh, where'm I gonna stay, here?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Who-ah-ho.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: We'll go to a hotel.

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: We'll go to a hotel.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No you won't.

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: No we won't.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: If you go to a hotel you'll be...doing stuff. I want you right here where I can keep an eye on you.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: You're gonna keep an eye on us?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That's right, mister, and I don't care how old you are, as long as you're under my roof you're gonna live by my rules. And that means no sleeping with your girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Wow. He's strict.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Now dad, you'll be in my room, Ronni uh, you can stay in Chandler's room.

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Thanks. You're, uh, you're a good kid.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: C'mon, I'll show you to my room. ...That sounds so weird when it's not followed by "No thanks, it's late."

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay. Now this is just for tonight. Starting tomorrow, you gotta make a change. This has gone on long enough.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: What kinda change?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, either you break it off with Ronni

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: I can't do that!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Then you gotta come clean with Ma! This is not right!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Yeah, but this is

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don't wanna hear it! Now go to my room!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, Kicky. What're you doing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Just trying to get comfortable. I can't sleep in my underwear.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, you're gonna.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I've been thinking. Y'know, about how I'm always seeing girls on top of girls...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are they end to end, or tall like pancakes?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y'know what I mean, about how I'm always going out with all these women. And I always figured, when the right one comes along, I'd be able to be a stand-up guy and go the distance, y'know? Now I'm looking at my dad, thinking...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, you're not him. You're you. When they were all over you to go into your father's pipe-fitting business, did you cave?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No. You decided to go into the out-of-work actor business. Now that wasn't easy, but you did it! And I'd like to believe that when the right woman comes along, you will have the courage and the guts to say "No thanks, I'm married."

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You really think so?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah. I really do.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks, Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Get off!

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi...May I help you?

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Yeah, uh, Joey said I could use your shower, since, uh, Chandler's in ours?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay...who are you?

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Oh, I'm Ronni. Ronni Rappelano? The mistress?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, c'mon in.

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi, I'm Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Bathroom's up there.

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, listen, Ronni, how long would you say Chandler's been in the shower?

utterance.speaker: Ronni
utterance.content: Oh, like, uh, five minutes?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Perfect. Fasten your seatbelts, it's peepee time. Hey, Mr. Trib.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Hey. Morning, dear.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler Bing? It's time to see your thing.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What's the matter with you?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I thought it was Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What? What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You were supposed to be in there so I could see your thing!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sorry, my my thing was in there with me.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey, Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How's it going?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Good. Oh oh! Roger's having a dinner thing and he wanted me to invite you guys.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So what's going on?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nothing, um, it's just, um... It's Roger.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I dunno, there's just something about...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Basically we just feel that he's...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We hate that guy.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah. Hate him.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We're sorry, Pheebs, we're sorry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh. Okay. Okay, don't you think, maybe, though, it's just that he's so perceptive that it freaks you out?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: ...No, we hate him.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We're sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ma! What're you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
utterance.content: I came to give you this and this.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oww! Big ring!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Why did you have to fill your father's head with all that garbage about making things right? Things were fine the way they were! There's chicken in there, put it away. For God's sake, Joey, really.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hold on, you-you knew?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Of course I knew! What did you think? Your father is no James Bond. You should've heard some of his cover stories. "I'm sleeping over at my accountant's," I mean, what is that? Please!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So then how could you I mean, how could you?!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Do you remember how your father used to be? Always yelling, always yelling nothing made him happy, nothing made him happy, not that wood shop, not those stupid little ships in the bottle, nothing. Now he's happy! I mean, it's nice, he has a hobby.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ma, I don't mean to be disrespectful, but... what the hell are you talking about?! I mean, what about you?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Me? I'm fine. Look, honey, in an ideal world, there'd be no her, and your father would look like Sting. And I'll tell you something else. Ever since that poodle-stuffer came along, he's been so ashamed of himself that he's been more attentive, he's been more loving... I mean, it's like every day's our anniversary.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'm...happy...for you?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Well don't be, because now everything's screwed up. I just want it the way it was.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ma, I'm sorry. I just did what I thought you'd want.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
utterance.content: I know you did, cookie. Oh, I know you did. So tell me. Did you see her?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. You're ten times prettier than she is.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Tribbiani
utterance.content: That's sweet. Could I take her?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: With this ring? No contest.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: What's wrong, sweetie?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Nothing, nothing.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: Aaaah, what's wrong, c'mon.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's, I mean, it's nothing, I'm fine. It's my friends. They-they have a liking problem with you. In that, um, they don't.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: Oh. They don't.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But they don't see all the wonderfulness that I see. They don't see all the good stuff and all the sweet stuff. They just think you're a little...

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Intense and creepy.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But I don't. Me, Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: Well, I'm not I'm not at all surprised they feel that way.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You're not? See, that's why you're so great!

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: Actually it's, it's quite, y'know, typical behaviour when you have this kind of dysfunctional group dynamic. Y'know, this kind of co-dependant, emotionally stunted, sitting in your stupid coffee house with your stupid big cups which, I'm sorry, might as well have nipples on them, and you're like all 'Oh, define me! Define me! Love me, I need love!'.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So you talked to your dad, huh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. He's gonna keep cheating on my ma like she wanted, she's gonna keep pretending she doesn't know even though she does, and my little sister Tina can't see her husband any more because he got a restraining order...which has nothing to do with anything except that I found out today.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Things sure have changed here on Waltons mountain.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So Joey, you okay?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess. It's just parents, after a certain point, you gotta let go. Even if you know better, you've gotta let them make their own mistakes.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Just think, in a couple of years we get to turn into them.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: If I turn into my parents, I'll either be an alcoholic blond chasing after twenty-year-old boys, or... I'll end up like my mom.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey, Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How's it going?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, okay, except I broke up with Roger.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Awww.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, right.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Aaawwwwww!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don't know, I mean, he's a good person, and he can be really sweet, and in some ways I think he is so right for me, it's just... I hate that guy!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, Joey. What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Clear the tracks for the boobie payback express. Next stop: Rachel Green.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey!! What the hell were you doing?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sorry. Wrong boobies.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hello, Joey.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Tribbiani
utterance.content: Oh! ...Hello, dear.
